intro: Elatostema rudicaule var. villiferum, commonly known as the creeping elatostema, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine, appressed hairs. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical structure is characterized by a rhizomatous root system that aids in its spreading growth habit.
